title: Suddenly bad ping from Fort Worth, TX on Charter
body:
Was getting 40-45 latency from Fort Worth, TX on Charter but now am getting 100.  Traceroute shows that the route is going all the way to seatttle on riotdirect.net instead of straight to Chicago.  Please fix I just transferred from Lan and now have this crap ping again..:( :(

http://imgur.com/53A4Z6o

replies.body:
Hey guys!

Level 3 has a major fiber cut right now.  Some of our links are down and some of our players (especially in Texas) are taking our redundant paths which are a little bit longer (as you can see in the trace route you are hitting Portland, then Seattle, before heading over to Chicago).

Level 3 is aware of the issue and are working to get this repaired.

Las
Does this consist of your in game settings changing? I played a game my smart cast was off and trinket was on 4 instead of T (where i have my key bind for trinkets)

I know it's focused on Texas, but is there a possibility that it's affecting other areas as well? I live in the midwest, so I mean it's close to Chicago, but ping has maybe increased by 1.5 times the average I get.

> [{quoted}](name=KDotYung,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=4oA15EHF,comment-id=00020003,timestamp=2015-11-19T23:04:37.688+0000)
>
> I know it's focused on Texas, but is there a possibility that it's affecting other areas as well? I live in the midwest, so I mean it's close to Chicago, but ping has maybe increased by 1.5 times the average I get.

Same for me. (posted above)

> [{quoted}](name=Riot LasIow,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=4oA15EHF,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-11-19T17:59:23.990+0000)
>
> Hey guys!
> 
> Level 3 has a major fiber cut right now.  Some of our links are down and some of our players (especially in Texas) are taking our redundant paths which are a little bit longer (as you can see in the trace route you are hitting Portland, then Seattle, before heading over to Chicago).
> 
> Level 3 is aware of the issue and are working to get this repaired.
> 
> Las

Ty, ty, I made a post on Reddit as well, and this was linked there by another user. I appreciate you guys already having looked into it and finding the problems, I was so worried that it would go unnoticed for a while.
Thanks homie. There are some other Reddit posts. I will link them over here.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot LasIow,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=4oA15EHF,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-11-19T17:59:23.990+0000)
>
> Hey guys!
> 
> Level 3 has a major fiber cut right now.  Some of our links are down and some of our players (especially in Texas) are taking our redundant paths which are a little bit longer (as you can see in the trace route you are hitting Portland, then Seattle, before heading over to Chicago).
> 
> Level 3 is aware of the issue and are working to get this repaired.
> 
> Las

Thanks for the update!

I experienced the same exact thing. I live in South Texas and use Time Warner Cable as my ISP. Normal ping has been 45, however today I wake up and ping is 110 constant. I already made sure that no one was streaming, using netflix, downloading, etc. So I know that it's nothing on my end that's causing the bad ping.
Louisiana is at 115 too

> [{quoted}](name=N00b School,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=4oA15EHF,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-11-19T20:09:18.377+0000)
>
> Louisiana is at 115 too

Louisiana is probably being sucked through Dallas as well.  I'm getting constant email updates from Level 3 so they are making progress on the cut and hopefully services should be restored soon.  Appreciate everyone's patience!

Las
I'm glad to know it's not just me. I also live in Texas I woke up today to find out i have 118 ping to what I had yesterday of 49ping.
Is the fiber cut fixed or still being worked on? I was getting 49ping last night. but again today I'm getting 118 ping. http://imgur.com/cUdpleb
I'm from florida but ive been having the same problem. stuck at 100-140 ping the past 2 days. went back down to 67-80 last night but spiked back up again today.
The issue seems to be fixed for me now.
dude, i actually have the same exact problem as you
Idaho went from 140 consistent ping to 180 spikey as hell.
Seattle is Always 285-600 Ping spikes every 5-10 mins (QQ)
thank you for the post
I'm having the same problem in Missouri, My ping is doubled and I've got bad packet loss. I've checked my internet and this only applies to league (the other games I play are fine).
Same here in Florida had 60 ping went up to 96 still playable but hoping for fix :)
Good to hear Riot is aware of it. Usually sit at 48 ping but got on today and was at 115. Thanks for working to get things repaired.

Europe is having problems too, please answer to my topic

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/EQeXEYn7-eune-problems-are-probably-ignored-by-european-rioters

Still have a higher than normal ping since the Nov. 6th roadmap update for Centurylink customers.  Not only is it still an issue, I am still getting awful lag spikes and now I can't run anything else while I'm playing LOL.

Riot can you please look into this?
